translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules for nuns
The second training rule on raised feet

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū ukkhittakāya antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū ukkhittakāya antaraghare nisīdanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas with their robes raised. …

analyzed: na ukkhittakāya antaraghare nisīdissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not sit in inhabited areas with my robe raised,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not sit in inhabited areas with one’s robe raised.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā ukkhipitvā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca ekatas vā ubhatas vā ukkhipitvā antaraghare nisīdati āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area with his robe raised either in front or behind, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,
if he is sick,🔽if he is traveling,🔽if there is a threat,
if he is the first offender.🔽The tenth training rule is finished.
The first sub-chapter on the proper way to sit is finished.
